text:
Hi :wave:

I have been working on a HubSpot for the past few months and I have really appreciated the push to the react side. I had a couple thoughts around local dev:

* hs-cms-dev-server . --generateFieldsTypes

This is great. On CI, I would like to ensure that the field types are up to date.

Could you possibly add a command to run this without starting up the server please?

* Build

Would it be possible to add a build command to hs-cms-dev-server. That way I can be sure that it will compile before merging to master.

Thank you!
what are you using localhost for??
like are you hardcoding local host into somethign?
I dont understand
I thought it was because I was using hs project dev. I'm not really sure...
are these front end errors in chrome dev tools?
Yes.
Generally there is a little > that you can click onto
that will open up those errors and you want to find the ones that are related to the page you are using
or like the component name
those errors that show up are what is like bulit out, you have to go deeper into the stack trace to see where your error is happenign
this isn’t the best example as I dolnt have an error right now
but clicking on that you can see the OrderCard.jsx --
so if you had a differnet error that you don’t recognize, you click that > and see more
Yeah, up above shows mine.
Can you screenshot?
Yeah, I can’t see anything there to trace down
do you have your .env set up with your secretts?
umm, maybe try commenting out different pieces of code to figure out what part of this it is?
I do. The serverless function works if run from vs code.
I see. I thought it was because of the Content Security Policy...
You're saying it's probably something in my code?

are you using this
`PRIVATE_APP_ACCESS_TOKEN` as the token?
I named it something different and that didn’t work
are you setting scopes correctly in app.json?
are you doing any console logging in the back end to see if the serverless function is getting ran ?

I am not using PRIVATE_APP_ACCESS_TOKEN.
I am doing console logging, but it only outputs when I run it from vs code.
If you want to use the scopesw that are set up in your app.json file, then you have to use the `process.env.PRIVATE_APP_ACCESS_TOKEN` as your token for serverless items
your logging in backend will only happen when youare running locally
Thank you. I'll try that. Can it be run through hs secrets or does it have to be dotenv?
I just add `.env` to project
and then set the token in that
Okay. Thank you. I'll try it.
Above is a basic serverless function I have set up that allows me to log out stuff and track down issues
